div.h2: Welcome to Cissna Park School District

div.font: Cissna Park Community Unit School District #6, In partnership with families and community, we continue our tradition of excellence, empowering students to become responsible citizens and life-long learners.
To sign up or login into your Teacherease account please click to the right.

span.font: Cissna Park School is rated as an A- School. Our school is a top rated school district. We currently meet or exceed state standards and we are constantly changing to ensure that our efforts and diversified education system help to continually guide our students to a strong future; no matter where their dreams might lead them.

div.blockquote:
Cissna Park C.U.S.D. #6 is a PreK-12 Grade public school district 90 square miles in area, all of which lies in southern Iroquois County. The District is located 100 miles south of Chicago and 50 miles northeast of Champaign-Urbana. The population of the district is approximately 2000. The three areas of population are the village of Cissna Park (850 residents), the unincorporated village of Claytonville, and the Kellart Lake subdivision. The primary source of employment are agriculture production and services, and government providers (school).
”
​

div.font: Cissna Park school is a proud participant in using clean, free, green energy. Our school currently utilizes a solar panel system which helps to provide roughly 1-3% of our schools current energy needs. Data for our solar production can be found by clicking the button on the below.

td.div:
​511 N. Second Street
Cissna Park, IL 60924
